experiment_info.name: intensity_prior_from_peak
experiment_info.description: Use physics to bound intensity search. Heat equation: T_max at sensor ∝ q/r². From observed max temperatures, estimate feasible (q, r) combinations to narrow search space.
experiment_info.hypothesis: Physics-based bounds on q might help narrow search

reason_aborted: Based on a misunderstanding of current approach. Intensity q is NOT searched - it's computed analytically via least squares given positions. The Variable Projection approach already optimally separates position search from intensity computation.

variable_projection_separable.finding: The baseline ALREADY uses Variable Projection implicitly - CMA-ES optimizes positions, q is computed analytically via least squares
variable_projection_separable.conclusion: There is no intensity search to bound

physics_informed_init.finding: Physics-based initialization (temperature gradients) FAILED to improve over simple hottest-sensor approach
physics_informed_init.conclusion: initialization family EXHAUSTED for this problem

technical_explanation: For each candidate position (x,y), the optimal intensity is computed as: q_optimal = dot(Y_unit, Y_obs) / dot(Y_unit, Y_unit). This is a closed-form solution, not a search. The q_range bounds (0.5, 2.0) are only used for clipping, not search.
